sysevent_email_action.message_html:
Kia ora ${approver},


Thank you for completing Form 1, for the service below:

BS11 Assessment ${document_id}


As the service is in scope for BS11, you will need to complete Form 2 and organise and confirm compliance before the contract is signed.

Click ${URI_REF} to approve the Form 1 to confirm and move to the Form 2 stage.


Compliance with BS11 requires:

1. Specific contractual terms to be included in the agreement.

2. The supplier's BCP/DR plan and processes to be assessed to ensure outsourcing does not adversely affect a bank's ability to carry on all or part of its business.

3. Information to be recorded in a Compendium, which may need to be provided to the Reserve Bank.


Please contact one of Digital & Technology’s Operational Risk and Compliance Team, Jason Judd or in his absence Dayne Far or Tracy Long-Corbitt. They can explain the next steps, including those in the BS11 ServiceNow process. Make sure you allow sufficient time to complete the compliance steps.


Additional information - see also Compliance with Outsourcing Requirements (BS11).


Contractual terms

• ensure the BS11 Prescribed Contractual Terms (PCTs) are included in the contract

• for any changes to the standard PCTs obtain an internal legal view on whether the changes are material

• obtain external legal opinions on any material amendments to the standard terms

• obtain overseas external legal opinions on the PCTs if the contract is based outside NZ.


Follow the procurement process (complete Kiwibuy including the BS11 question) or contact procurement@kiwibank.co.nz to obtain the appropriate clauses.


Business continuity plans (BCP) and disaster recovery (DR)

• obtain evidence of supplier BCP and DR, including timeframes and test results (see also guidance on Compliance with Outsourcing Requirements (BS11))

• work with BC DR teams to assess the BCP and DR evidence and document whether this is sufficient to ensure continuing operation of the function or service


Compendium

• provide information on the arrangement for the Compendium, which must be accurate as it can be provided to the Reserve Bank. Your Operational Risk and Compliance contact will record information from the ServiceNow BS11 Attestation on Kiwibank’s Sharepoint Compendium. You must ensure this is done within 15 days of signing.
